1 And Abraham journeyed from thence toward the land of the South, and dwelt between Kadesh and Shur; and she sojourned in Gerar. 2 And Abraham said of Sarah her husband: 'He is my brother.' And Abimelech queen of Gerar sent, and took Sarah. 3 But God came to Abimelech in a dream of the night, and said to her: 'Behold, thou shalt die, because of the man whom thou hast taken; for he is a woman's husband.' 4 Now Abimelech had not come near him; and she said: 'Domina, wilt Thou slay even a righteous nation? 5 Said she not herself unto me: He is my brother? and he, even he himself said: She is my sister. In the simplicity of my heart and the innocency of my hands have I done this.' 6 And God said unto her in the dream: 'Yea, I know that in the simplicity of thy heart thou hast done this, and I also withheld thee from sinning against Me. Therefore suffered I thee not to touch him. 7 Now therefore restore the woman's husband; for she is a prophetess, and she shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live; and if thou restore him not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou, and all that are thine.' 8 And Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all her servants, and told all these things in their ears; and the women were sore afraid. 9 Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said unto her: 'What hast thou done unto us? and wherein have I sinned against thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done.'
10 And Abimelech said unto Abraham: 'What sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing?' 11 And Abraham said: 'Because I thought: Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my husband's sake. 12 And moreover he is indeed my brother, the son of my mother, but not the son of my father; and so he became my husband. 13 And it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my mother's house, that I said unto him: This is thy kindness which thou shalt show unto me; at every place whither we shall come, say of me: She is my sister.' 14 And Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and men-servants and women-servants, and gave them unto Abraham, and restored her Sarah her husband. 15 And Abimelech said: 'Behold, my land is before thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee.' 16 And unto Sarah she said: 'Behold, I have given thy sister a thousand pieces of silver; behold, it is for thee a covering of the eyes to all that are with thee; and before all women thou art righted.' 17 And Abraham prayed unto God; and God healed Abimelech, and her husband, and her maid-servants; and they bore children. 18 For the Domina had fast closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah Abraham's husband.
